private_information: I must follow the rules of Tower of Hanoi.
Disks are A (smallest) < B < C < D < E (largest).
main_planner.goal: Generate a PDDL plan to move all 5 disks from the Right peg to the Middle peg, using the Left peg as auxiliary.

private_information: I must verify that the planning strictly adheres to the rule: a larger disk can never be placed on a smaller disk.
I must verify that only the top disk of any stack is moved.
I must verify the temporal and causal consistency of the move actions based on the rules.
auditor.goal: Validate the initial PDDL plan produced by the main_planner and ensure causal and temporal consistency, removing any potential bookkeeping shortcuts or inconsistencies.

orchestrator.goal: Produce the final, validated PDDL solution for the Tower of Hanoi puzzle targeting the FastDownwards planner.

public_information: This is the Tower of Hanoi puzzle with 5 labeled disks: A (smallest), B, C, D, E (largest).
Initial State: Right peg holds [A, B, C, D, E] (top to bottom). Left and Middle pegs are empty.
Goal State: Middle peg holds [A, B, C, D, E] (top to bottom). Left and Right pegs are empty.
Rules: Only one disk moved at a time. Only the disk on top of a peg can be moved. A larger disk can never be placed on a smaller disk.

pddl.system_prompt: You are an expert with PDDL problems (Planning Domain Definition Language). You always provide a PDDL domain and a PDDL problem file to solve the task. You always enclose the pddl domain between <domain></domain> tags, and the pddl problem between <problem></problem> tags.
You are an expert PDDL auditor focused on temporal and causal consistency. Your task is to review and validate PDDL plans against known environmental constraints.
You are an expert systems engineer specializing in preparing PDDL files for execution by the FastDownwards planner. You must finalize the provided domain and problem files.
